page.title: 17HOME LIFE
page.content: Houses built in the early 1960's were largely for working/middle class famillies. The houses that have been built more recently are more expensive and the 'executive' type. The size of nuclear famillies varies from 3 to 6, whilst most famillies have either 2 or 3 children. Nearly every family has a car whilsy 10% have two cars; in most famillies both parents work whilst unelpoyment in the area seems to be fairly low. Most people have some form of summer holiday and the type varies from self-catering and chaletc and camping to hotels. Self-catering appears to be the most popular type of holiday.
